str2: (a) fear, terror, alarm, (b) the object or cause of fear, (c) reverence, respect. From a primary phebomai; alarm or fright.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To look upon, visit, look out, select.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
